metadata.name: Reverie #193
metadata.description:
Reverie: a state of being pleasantly lost in one's thoughts; a daydream.

I love impressionist paintings of nature, where the visible brushstrokes give a glimpse into the artist‚Äôs process. With this collection I aimed to capture a slice of nature with distinctly digital ‚Äúbrushstrokes‚Äù. Looking closely, you can see many of the lines, curves and polygons that combined to form each Reverie. 

Keyboard Interactions:
[z] Change color / season. There are two seasons, winter and not-winter. Weather (wind, ice) is as unpredictable as it is in nature.
[p] Play / pause. Automatically cycle through colors and seasons.
[s] Save 1000x1000px image (instant)
[2] Save 2000x2000px image (fast)
[4] Save 4000x4000px image (slowish)


Elsif 2022, made with p5js.

metadata.name: anomalia.12 #51
metadata.description:
Each one of the creations are movements in search of irregularity. Sequential modulation of shapes with the oscillator causes a sense of depth. With the help of noise and voronoi, it was possible to simulate a kind of dance between the shapes. Made with Hydra library.

Full screen will provide you a better view of the elements.

humachine
humanized
experiment

S√£o Paulo, Brasil. 25/Janeiro/2022

This work is licenced with CC BY-NC-SA 4.0

metadata.name: üå± Potted & Printed #193
metadata.description:
Note:
This token is CPU intensive and may take long to render. 

---

Description:
Potted & Printed is a series of generative potted plants. There are 7 species and they have been selected from my very many indoor plants at home. The species are: 
- Snake Plant
- Monstera Adonsonii
- Alocasia
- Bird's Nest Fern
- False Shamrock
- Ponytail Palm
- Parlor Palm

---

Saving:
To save a 3500x3500 PNG file, double click/tap or press 's' 

---

Made by Sam Tsao (@sam___tsao) with p5.js

metadata.name: possibleScapes #26
metadata.description:
When memory, photography and code interrelate.

The animated images, accumulations of other images, reveal themselves as fragments of memory.

Like old slides from a time gone by, logs bring possibleScapes that connect differently with each of the spectators.

Working together as a continuous system of gears, the algorithm is associated with the image bank, creating the most diverse interferences, revealing unique possibilities for experimenting with memory.

This is a commemorative token, for the participation of the "savedScapes" project (https://www.fxhash.xyz/generative/16116) in the NFT SHOW EUROPE 2022 on the weekend of 17th and 18th September 2022.

As a thank you for all your support, "savedScapes" holders will have the right to mint the same number of editions for free.

The print with all holders will be done tomorrow (September 18th) at 10:00 BRT | 13:00 UTC | 15:00 CEST, and the token will open for collection after one hour at 11:00 am BRT | 14:00 UTC | 16:00 CEST.

Nothing is just one thing.

Generative Token by of Morbeck for fxhash

september 17, 2022

metadata.name: Erosion #73
metadata.description:
In my latest works I used warped FBM noise as a tools.

Here, in this #tezos4tezos drop, is used directly to generate the token.

The results resemble natural phenomena as turbulence, fluid mixing, erosion.

objkt.name: E s q u a d r o s #43

metadata.name: E s q u a d r o s #43
metadata.description:
Set-square is an instrument in the form of a right triangle, used to draw angles and perpendiculars, in Portuguese we call it Esquadro.

When developing this study, I reflected on the action of order and disorder of alignments, the need I feel when instinctively seeking order and at the same time learning to live with disorder. Programming was like learning to draw all over again, and in Esquadros I try to extrapolate this issue by using simple geometric shapes and slightly playful colors, portraying this phase of starting over.

Esquadros displays some simple variations: density, palettes, a little clutter in some pieces and some inverted colors.

Appreciate the simple shapes and colors that life offers us, even in the midst of a lot of order and disorder. This is my genesis for Fx Hash.

Key controls:

k : save png
l : show pallete label

Artwork by Zizou, @Zizoutez.

Made with p5.js and <3

metadata.name: Bankoo #33
metadata.description:
The word affects and reshapes land in an eternal cycle.

The development of this series invited me to cross the land through songs and glyphs and to discover the Manding languages script: N'Ko. It is a cables.gl patch that blends procedural terrains and text strings made from 8 letters whose order is continuously randomized (it takes some time, be patient).

The piece has some controls:
- Use 1, 2, 3 and 4 to change the view.
- Use P to open the performance panel.
- Use S to download a black and white image of the terrain to use as height map or to hear it using PIXELSYNTH (https://ojack.xyz/PIXELSYNTH/)

A more detailed article about this artwork can be found here: https://www.fxhash.xyz/article/bankoo-or-nko-or-u%2B07c0-u%2B07ff ‚õ∞Ô∏è

metadata.name: 0RAL B1NARY: ‚ÄúBINARY ODE‚Äù #118
metadata.description:
An ‚Äúalgorhythmic‚Äù exploration of the oral/aural tradition in poetry. 

‚ÄúZero is a time of night.
Zero is the color of snow.
Zero is the space between notes.
Zero is the silence between words.
Zero is the pause before breath.
Zero is void in the heart of a crowd.
Zero is not nothing, but it‚Äôs not everything.
One is a time of day.
One is the color of spring grass in sunlight.
One is the warmth at the back of my neck when I turn to find you standing there.
One is the rhythm at the base of my spine.
One is the peace at the core of my being.
One is the sound of your voice in the dark.
And one more thing:
Without one I am nothing‚Ä¶‚Äù
‚ÄìTechnelegy 
 

Fusing AI-powered verse, spoken word, original music and visuals all in generative composition, this playful ode to our universal language is inspired by Stiles‚Äô binary-based art and Stern‚Äôs performative poetics. The experiment centers on a transhuman poem by Stiles‚Äô AI alter ego, Technelegy, voiced as zeroes and ones, layered with human- and machine-generated sound ‚Äì evoking ancient data transmissions in the oral tradition as well as the immersive potential of multisensorial, multimedia, metaversal language and literature. Brought into existence via the blockchain, it is a new form of ‚Äútoken word poetry.‚Äù


As with the duo‚Äôs other poetry ‚Äúunreadings,‚Äù all minters will receive an airdropped broadside of the full poem after all editions are collected. A 1/1 media-rich version of the entire poem will also be made available. 
 
Poetic traits:
- 321 editions performed by the algorithm, out of billions of possible combinations
- Each unique piece contains between 3 and 6 (out of 60) lines of generative text from a poem by Technelegy ‚Äì a custom text generator fine-tuned on Stiles‚Äô writing and research material, seeded with prompts from Stiles‚Äô and Stern‚Äôs work ‚Äì translated into binary and performed by Stiles
- 24 possible binary backbeats performed by Stern in his ‚ÄúNathaniel Fun Time‚Äù (NFT) stylings, and generatively re-mixed
- 98 possible intros
- 15 musical stems composed by Kris Bones, generating millions of possible mixes
- Thousands of possible ending combinations 
- 5 fonts, layered in billions of potential ways, including Stern and Stiles‚Äô custom AI font, NNFT (Neural Network Font Type), developed for their ongoing collaboration, ‚ÄúMother Computer‚Äù
- 13 color palettes based on Stern and Stiles‚Äô respective artworka
- Very rare attributes including music-less performance, poem-less music, repeated ‚ÄúB1nary 0de‚Äù (title only)

Click to start and stop or replay. Although the first play through will be the same every time, starting and stopping may create minor variations in your mix (though not any of the core attributes).

0RAL B1NARY: ‚ÄúBINARY ODE‚Äù was produced with partial support from Refraction DAO‚Äôs Creative Grants program, and premiered as part of Refraction Festival at Art Basel Miami 2022. 15% of primary sales go to Refraction, and 5% of primary sales will be donated to Black Girls Code.

metadata.name: ____ - Iteration 2 #449
metadata.description:
This project is part of a larger experiment that explores and celebrates the process of making generative art by progressively releasing iterations, working towards a final release on my main account (tz1RkYY3jr1ocuPdQqrRefr5FqoawKQsmBmD). The iterations will be titled ____ - Iteration 1, ____ - Iteration 2, etc. At this point, the number of iterations has not been determined, but more information will be provided as this experiment unfolds.

The final release will only be made available to those who have collected each iteration (using an allowlist), and will be released for free.

In live mode, add &size=<YOUR_PIXEL_SIZE> to change the pixel size of the image for export (Right click to save). For example, &size=4000 will set the width of the image to be 4000 pixels.

metadata.name: Charcoal Seeds #73
metadata.description:
As a fundamental element derived from organic matter, charcoal happens to be at the core of all life forms. It is also the tool for artists that dates back to the most ancient times. 
By using charcoal as the the primary medium for the exhibition ‚ÄòOrganic Matr‚Äô (and resulting series of physical pieces created in collaboration with Brooklyn-based lab ArtMatr), the works creates bonds between technology and the rawest tool that was touched by the human hand, and highlights how the cycle of life is also the cycle of regeneration of matter.

Since the generative process _that uses programming code and the intervention of randomness_ was used to design the physical pieces, the long-form generative series Charcoal Seeds is a natural way to seamlessly extend back into the digital realm the ideas of matter and physicality, while showing the elements at work in the creation process. 
In each iteration a virtual seed will encapsulates the essence of organic forms and patterns. The graphic style itself tries to convey the organic feeling of tools and materials such as chalk, ink, paintbrushes. 


‚Äî‚Äî 

- "Charcoal Seeds" offers a WYSIWYG experience : by deriving the randomness from the minter‚Äôs wallet address, it is guaranteed that what you see onscreen after adjusting the params will be your actual NFT. 
However, we wanted to allow the possibility of getting some rare features. By selecting "random" for the Format or the Paper color, you will get a chance to mint a Pink or a Back background, or have a Wide Landscape format. Beware : this will break the WYSIWYG ( but it will keep your params settings safe ) 

- As usual, the project is plottable : press [s] in live mode to generate a SVG file suited for pen plotters.

- By adding a ‚Äòscale‚Äô parameter in the live URL, you can generate a higher resolution image. The scale ranges from 1 to 10 with a default value of 3.
